## How to build a tree: parsimony
<hr>

Parsimony
• A logical way to identify synapomorphies,
homoplasies
• Parsimony minimizes the number of
evolutionary changes (or steps) needed to
explain all the data you collect for
characters on an evolutionary tree

## Whale Evolution: A Case History

• Traditionally, phylogenetic trees
based on morphological data place
whales outside of the artiodactyl
group — mammals such as cows,
deer, and hippos that have hooves, an
even number of toes, and an unusual
pulley-shaped ankle bone

## The astragalus ankle bone is a
synapomorphy shared by all artiodactyls
